q: to the US has reminded him of the period before American Idol premiered in 2002.`` I kind of feel at the moment like I did when we were launching American Idol,'' he said. I was excited about the show, I was excited about the prospects, but I hadn't a clue whether it was going to be a hit or whether we were going to be kicked out of the country after three weeks. Simon Cowell then quipped:`` I remember the network put a one-month break clause in the house I was renting, which shows at the time I don't think they were particularly convinced either.'' stated

in Turkey, returned to the U.S. to have a lesion surgically removed from his right leg, spurring rumors he will retire. Allen Iverson denies this, as he wrote on his Twitter account: I have never said anything about retirement, nor have I said goodbye to the game of basketball. Once I get past this, my plan is to continue playing at the highest level possible. So don't put me in my rocking chair just yet. Hold on, I'll be back! It's not yet known if the lesion is benign or not, or if it's a cyst. Allen Iverson , 35, is expected to be out for several weeks

Eric Schmidt assumes his new role as executive chairman, which will focus on external relations with customers, partners and government agencies, he may have more time to spend advocating for Google Apps in the marketplace. Network systems and data analysts, and medical scientists are the fastest growing occupations, but, despite the focus on`` knowledge'' jobs, the great majority of job openings will be in the low tech, non-professional positions, in jobs such as personal and home care aides, retail salespersons, cashiers, waiters and waitresses, and food preparation workers, Michael Bernick concludes. up on repealing Obamacare. While he acknowledges that the Senate will likely stall the effort, he is hopeful that things could change.`` I think that it is a very dynamic environment,'' he says. House passage puts the onus on the Senate. And last time I checked, you've got about two dozen members of the Democratic majority in the Senate who are up for election in two years. As the American people engage on this issue, I like our chances. In the meantime, Republicans, Mike Pence says, will use the`` power of the purse'' to block Obamacare's implementation.`` We have a wide variety of legislative tools available.'' reports,
